description: This course introduces students to the comparative study of Afro-Caribbean literature. Students
explore the literature of the region after the 1950s in a relational framework to understand the
commonalities and differences of its peoples, cultures, and literatures. Students read novels,
essays, theory, and poetry from different linguistic and cultural areas of the region. Specific
attention will be given to the genre of marvelous realism. Offered periodically in spring
